concept_data.title: Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union
concept_data.preferred_term: Treaty on the Functioning of the EU

summary: The "Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union" (TFEU) serves as a foundational legal document that delineates the operational framework of the EU. It establishes the principles governing the internal market, competition, and economic policies, thereby facilitating the integration of member states. As a redirect to the preferred term "Treaty on the Functioning of the EU," it underscores the treaty's pivotal role in shaping EU law and regulatory mechanisms. The TFEU is instrumental in ensuring compliance with EU legislation, promoting cohesion among member states, and safeguarding the rights of citizens within the Union's jurisdiction.
